entry.title: Sabrina Thompson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that aerospace engineer Sabrina Thompson (pictured) founded a streetwear brand after she felt the "artist inside of me was internally starving", despite being satisfied with her career?

entry.title: Nanjing Massacre Memorial Day (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nanjing Massacre Memorial Day has a memorial tripod?

entry.title: Alfred Fell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Alfred Fell moved his family to England for better education opportunities, his son Walter Fell and two of his brothers returned permanently to New Zealand?

entry.title: Walter Hines Page School of International Relations (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that scholars disagree about whether the closure of the Walter Hines Page School of International Relations in 1953 had anything to do with McCarthyism?

entry.title: Howard Mayers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Howard Mayers is credited with the destruction of at least eleven enemy aircraft during World War II?

entry.title: Dear John (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that musician John Mayer dismissed Taylor Swift's "Dear John" as "cheap songwriting"?

entry.title: Yu Yan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chinese physician Yu Yan described theories like yinyang and the five phases as "simply all lies, absolutely not factual, and completely groundless"?

entry.title: Paseo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Seattle sandwich restaurant Paseo abruptly closed, fans left flowers and lit candles?
